title: Pragmatism
heading: Pragmatic, Evolutionary Processes (PEP)
content:
Instead of focusing on the 'perfect process' assuming that results will follow, in Lean a process is only as good as the results it delivers.

This means that when the reality changes and the results are not the expected ones, some processes may need to be changed. Partially or completely.

If you are familiar with Scrum, 'Inspect & Adapt'.

With ZenSum, you learn how to see the reality, measure impacts and adapt. That's the key to success.

Be pragmatic, not dogmatic.

A living process that evolves and adapts to a changing reality, is a good symptom that an organization is alive.
